com.ikalagaming.util

Class BinaryTree<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikalagaming.util.BinaryTree<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of object to store. Must extend Comparable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IntegerTree

    public class BinaryTree<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
    A binary AVL tree for storing (comparable) objects.
    Author:
    Ches Burks

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int size
      How many elements are stored in the tree.

      The base of the tree.

      Returns the AVL balance factor of the node.

    • Field Detail

      • treeRoot

        protected BinaryTreeNode<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>> treeRoot
        The base of the tree. This is null if the tree is empty.

      • size

        protected int size
        How many elements are stored in the tree.

        public BinaryTree()

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all objects from the tree.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(T toFind)
        Returns true if the tree contains the given object
        Parameters:
        toFind - the entry to search for
        Returns:
        true if the object exists or false if it is not in the tree

      • find

        protected BinaryTreeNode<T> find(T toFind,
                                 BinaryTreeNode<T> root)
        Recursively searches for the entry and returns the node that contains it or null if it is not found.
        Parameters:
        toFind - the entry to search for
        root - where to start looking
        Returns:
        null or the node that has toFind as its key

      • getBalance

        protected int getBalance(BinaryTreeNode<T> node)
        Returns the AVL balance factor of the node. That is, 0 if the node is null, or the height of the left subtree minus the height of the right subtree. This should be -1, 0, or 1 unless the node needs to be rebalanced.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to find the balance of
        Returns:
        the nodes AVL balance factor
        See Also:
        getHeight(BinaryTreeNode)

      • getHeight

        protected int getHeight(BinaryTreeNode<T> node)
        Returns the height of the node, or -1 if it is null.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to get the height of
        Returns:
        the tree's (with node as the root) maximum height

      • getSmallestSubnode

        protected BinaryTreeNode<T> getSmallestSubnode(BinaryTreeNode<T> root)
        Returns the smallest child node of the tree that has root as its parent. If root is null it just returns null. If root has no children, it returns itself.
        Parameters:
        root - the root of the tree to search
        Returns:
        the smallest node in that subtree

      • insert

        protected BinaryTreeNode<T> insert(BinaryTreeNode<T> theRoot,
                                   T ins)
                            throws DuplicateEntry
        Inserts an object into the tree using recursive calls, with a root at theRoot. Returns the new root of the tree. The root of the tree should be passed as theRoot and then set to the return value.
        Parameters:
        theRoot - the root of the tree to insert into
        ins - the value to insert
        Returns:
        the new root of the tree (where theRoot was before)
        Throws:
        DuplicateEntry - if the entry already exists in the tree

      • insert

        public void insert(T toInsert)
            throws DuplicateEntry
        Inserts the given value into the tree.
        Parameters:
        toInsert - the object to store
        Throws:
        DuplicateEntry - if the entry already exists in the tree

      • leftRotate

        protected BinaryTreeNode<T> leftRotate(BinaryTreeNode<T> root)
        Rotates the given node left and returns the new root that is where root used to be. Updates heights of nodes and parents appropriately. If the root's right child is null then it just returns the root because it can't rotate.
        Parameters:
        root - the root of the three nodes to rotate
        Returns:
        the new root

      • max

        protected int max(int a,
                  int b)
        Returns the larger of the two numbers.
        Parameters:
        a - the first number
        b - the second number
        Returns:
        whichever number is largest

      • rebalance

        protected void rebalance(BinaryTreeNode<T> lowest)
        Rebalances the tree starting at the given the lowest possibly unbalanced node and working up the path to the root.
        Parameters:
        lowest - the lowest node in the tree that might be unbalance or was changed

      • remove

        protected void remove(BinaryTreeNode<T> toRemove)
        Removes the given node from the tree. This will nullify the pointer to toRemove.
        Parameters:
        toRemove - the node to remove

      • remove

        public void remove(T toRemove)
        Removes the object form the tree if it exists.
        Parameters:
        toRemove - the object to remove

      • rightRotate

        protected BinaryTreeNode<T> rightRotate(BinaryTreeNode<T> root)
        Rotates the given node right and returns the new root that is where root used to be. Updates heights of nodes and parents appropriately. If the root's left child is null, it just returns the root because it can't rotate.
        Parameters:
        root - the root of the three nodes to rotate
        Returns:
        the new root

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of elements in this tree.
        Returns:
        the data structures size

      • updateHeight

        protected void updateHeight(BinaryTreeNode<T> changed)
        Recursively updates the heights of the parents of this node
        Parameters:
        changed - the lowest node that needs to be updated
